page.title: 18STREET NAMES
page.content: Street names may tell us something about the local history of our D-block. {Priory Lane} got its name from an old priory.We think it may have a connection with Kingsway, Queensway ,and Princess Road because castles were often built near monasteries. {Howick Cross Lane} has a cross at the entrance to it as a memorial to those who died in World War One. Nearby each other we have Howick Cross Lane,Howick Moor Lane,Howick Park Close and Howick Park Drive telling us that Howick used to be an important area. {Riddingwood} and {Blashaw Lane} are both named after nearby woods. Most street names end with Road,Close ,Grove ,Avenue ,Drive ,or Lane though in our D-block we have found sreet names ending with Wood ,Way ,Gate ,and End.
